info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued April 02 at 4:47AM PDT until April 03 at 5:00AM PDT by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM PDT MONDAY ABOVE 2500 FEET... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 AM PDT MONDAY... * WHAT...For the Winter Storm Warning above 2500 feet, heavy snow. Additional snow accumulations of 2 to 12 inches. For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow expected. Total snow accumulations of up to 9 inches. * WHERE...For the Winter Storm Warning, Eastern Jackson County, including Butte Falls and Prospect. Highways 62 north of Prospect, 140 near the Cascades foothills, and 227 north of Trail. For the Winter Weather Advisory, Talent, Ashland, Shady Cove, and portions of I-5. * WHEN...For the Winter Storm Warning, until 11 AM PDT Monday. For the Winter Weather Advisory, from 11 PM this evening to 5 AM PDT Monday. * IMPACTS...For areas under the Winter Weather Advisory, travel could be impacted from reduced visibility while snow falls and wet roads. The main impact will be accumulating snow off roadways, except dirt roads could see minor accumulations. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The Winter Weather Advisory concerns accumulating snow off roadways because road surface temperatures will be above freezing. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Travel is strongly discouraged because of dangerous conditions. * If you must travel, keep tire chains, a flashlight, blankets, food, water, medications, and a fully charged phone with you. * The safest place during a winter storm is indoors. * A Winter Storm Warning means that severe winter weather is imminent and poses a threat to life and property. Take protective action now.
